hero.title: Care, environment and enrichment
hero.subtitle: Rats do not just need survival. They need movement, exploration, social contact and a sense of safety.

body.text: Good housing balances hygiene, ventilation and security. Wire cages with solid shelves, deep bases and multiple levels often work better than single-level tanks.

items: Enough floor space and height for climbing and running.
Multiple hiding places and levels so rats can choose where to rest.

image.alt: Enrichment items in a rat cage

body.text: Enrichment is not just toys. It is everything that gives rats choices, encourages natural behaviors and allows them to interact with their environment.

items: Foraging opportunities instead of only bowl feeding.
Climbing structures, tunnels, hammocks and chew items.
Time outside the cage in a safe play area.
